intro: Tryphostemma mendesii, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are usually ovate or lanceolate, and it produces small, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
